intro: Melochia indica var. deglabrata, commonly known as the leafless melochia, is a variant of the melochia plant characterized by its reduced foliage. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically features showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its stems are often hairy and can grow upright or trailing, depending on the environment. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
